pageContext.description:
This full-length portrait of Princess Marie (1562-1566), the younger sister of Prince Christian I of Saxony belongs to a series of six portraits completed between 1563 and 1565, depicting Elector Augustus of Saxony (1526-1586), his wife, Princess Anna of Denmark (1532–1585) and their four children. Marie who died aged three is shown here holding a doll and facing right, while standing on a marble floor she casts a shadow on the neutral background. She is wearing a long dress with puffed sleeves and a white apron. Her head is covered by a tight-fitting white bonnet and her attire is completed by two long necklaces.
[cda 2021]

[Exhib. Cat. Berlin 1937, no. 148]

metadata.title: Portrait of Princess Marie, sister of Christian I

pageContext.provenance:
- 1806 recorded in the catalogue of the Picture Gallery at the Dresden court (nos. 316, 317)
- 1860 transferred to the 'Obermarschallamt' (Marschal Services) for decorative purposes
- 1924 transferred to the House of Wettin within the context of the Expropriation of the Princes in the Weimar Republic
- in the collection of Prince Ernst Heinrich, Duke of Saxony, Moritzburg[1]
- private collection
[1][Exhib. Cat. Berlin 1937, no. 148]
[Exhib. Cat. Chemnitz 2002, 515-517, 522]
pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia at the bottom right: serpent with dropped wings, facing left, dated above '1564'

titles.title: Portrait of Princess Marie, sister of Christian I
